title: An Attempt At: Making Stormrazor less toxic and giving it some of Infinity Edge's old feel.
body:
[](https://i.imgur.com/bVyugS5.png)

Hey fellas dipshit here back at it again with the second "installment" of "An Attempt At", where I give my own thoughts and proposed balance changes that I think would benefit the game.

Today I want to talk about everyone's undisputed favourite item, Stormrazor.

Keep in mind that whatever I say here is just my own opinion. Feel free to disagree down below.

---

#Why is the current Stormrazor a problem?

The current Stormrazor is a problem because it does nothing to promote what a Marksman is supposed to do: Sustained DPS.

Stormrazor gives you a free crit on engage, which leans more towards upfront burst damage than it does DPS, and then discourages you from attacking for the next few seconds in order to get another free crit.

Essentially, this makes ADCs shittier burst champions and as was to be expected, it quickly became a top tier item on Assassins.

Another thing, whilst not a major problem with the item, it becomes obsolete the more crit items you build, as the closer you come to 100% crit chance, the less valuable the free crit becomes.

Now, of course the best option would be to just remove the item, I wanted to see if I couldn't find at least some way to make it enjoyable, whilst also not making it too broken.

In the next segment, I'll list my proposed change that'll keep the "free crits" aspect of the item, but change it to be more DPS oriented rather than burst oriented as well as not make it obsolete come late game.

---

#So what's the proposed change to the item then?

When thinking of a proposed change I looked at the glaring problems I needed to be able to solve with this change:

1. Remove burst oriented nature.

2. Make it relevant in the late game.

3. Remove it's abusability on some champions like Graves and Jhin.

My idea for the proposed change came from looking through old items that were once in the game.

One such item I stumbled upon was Ionic Spark.

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Ionic_Spark

Basically, what Ionic Spark did was give you a lightning effect on every 4th auto attack, dealing magic damage to up to 4 targets, similar to the Statikk Shiv we currently have.

I also looked at the old version of Infinity Edge, which gave you critical strike damage rather than true damage.

I tried to take both of these things and perhaps see how they could fit into Stormrazor and this is what I came up with.

---

#Stormrazor Idea Number 1.

**(RANGED ONLY)**

**Cost: 2600 gold.**

**Attack Damage: 50.**

**Attack Speed: 25%.**

**Unique Passive - Storm's Edge: Every fourth auto attack will critically strike for 200% damage. All stacks are lost if you haven't auto attacked something for the last 10 seconds.**

**Unique Passive - Nothing Goes To Waste: Every percentage of Critical Strike Chance that exceeds 100% is converted into Critical Strike Damage that only applies to Storm's Edge critical strikes. Damage is capped at 250% maximum damage.**

Builds out of: {{item:1042}} + {{item:1038}} + {{item:1042}} + 700 gold.

To give an example to the Nothing Goes To Waste passive, say you have 4 items. Stormrazor, Statikk Shiv, Rapid Firecannon and Infinity Edge.

That's 120% critical strike chance.

That means everyone of your normal critical strikes will deal the standard 200% damage, but every fourth critical strike will deal 220% damage.

To make sure this doesn't get out of hand, the maximum amount of damage you'll be able to deal with one Storm's Edge proc will be 250%, achieved through buying 3 Zeal items and Infinity Edge. I've also removed the bonus movement speed burst from Storm's Edge.

---

#Stormrazor Idea Number 2 (suggested by Alfavhunter).

**(RANGED ONLY)**

**Cost: 2600 gold.**

**Attack Damage: 50.**

**Attack Speed: 25%.**

**Unique Passive - Storm's Edge: Every fourth auto attack will critically strike for 200% damage. All stacks are lost if you haven't auto attacked something for the last 10 seconds.**

**Unique Passive - Gone With The Wind: Every percentage of Critical Strike Chance that exceeds 100% is converted into Bonus Movement Speed from proccing Storm's Edge critical strikes (lasts for 2 seconds).**

Builds out of: {{item:1042}} + {{item:1038}} + {{item:1042}} + 700 gold.

To give an example to the Gone With The Wind passive, say you have 4 items. Stormrazor, Statikk Shiv, Rapid Firecannon and Infinity Edge.

That's 120% critical strike chance.

That means that for every fourth auto attack (Storm's Edge procs), you'll get a short burst of 20% Movement Speed that lasts for 2 seconds.

Basically means, with the maximum amount of critical strike chance possible (240%), your Storm's Edge critical strikes will give you 140% movement speed for 2 seconds.

#Stormrazor Idea Number 3 (suggested by Z3Sleeper).

**(RANGED ONLY)**

**Cost: 2600 gold.**

**Attack Damage: 50.**

**Attack Speed: 25%.**

**Unique Passive - Storm's Edge: Every fourth auto attack will critically strike for 200% damage. All stacks are lost if you haven't auto attacked something for the last 10 seconds.**

**Unique Passive - Spray and Pray: Every percentage of Critical Strike Chance that exceeds 100% is converted into Bonus Attack Speed from proccing Storm's Edge critical strikes (lasts for 2 seconds).**

To give an example to the Spray and Pray passive, say you have 4 items. Stormrazor, Statikk Shiv, Rapid Firecannon and Infinity Edge.

That's 120% critical strike chance.

That means that for every fourth auto attack (Storm's Edge procs), you'll get a short burst of 20% Attack Speed that lasts for 2 seconds.

Basically means, with the maximum amount of critical strike chance possible (240%), your Storm's Edge critical strikes will give you 140% bonus Attack Speed for 2 seconds.

---

I hope the post was well structured enough and comprehensible to read.

Like I said above, this is just my own opinion. You're allowed to share your own thoughts down below.

I'll even leave a poll so you can easily vote without having to go into detail.

So yeah, that's my proposed change to Stormrazor.

Thanks for reading.

#EDIT: Added two versions of the item since some people said the critical strike damage passive might be a bit overpowered. Made both versions ranged only to prevent abuse from champions like Tryndamere and Yasuo. I also made stacks run out out of combat based on Avantel Wings' suggestion. Tell me what you guys think of the new version.

#EDIT 2: Added another version of the item based on Z3Sleeper's suggestion.

No

Stormrazor isn't supposed to be a scaling item. It's SUPPOSED to tide you over so you can scale off of future purchases. Making it a late game item negates the point of its implementation to begin with, and no one wants a "feel like old IE". Old IE was busted. There's a reason we stopped with 250% damage crits.

Learn from the past. Don't repeat it.

> 
> Learn from the past. Don't repeat it.

This version of Stormrazor isn't as much a scaling item as it's just a "not completely useless late game" item.

The free crit will still be kind of redundant once you have 100% crit chance.

The 20% crit chance you end up having in excess from buying 2 Zeal items and Infinity Edge has always bothered me since it's implementation and I wanted to see if it could be shifted somewhere else without being completely broken.

And don't worry, it won't be nearly as broken as old IE. Old IE gave 50% more damage that applied to *every* critical strike. This one will only apply to every fourth one and it will only deal bonus damage based off of excess critical strike chance.

If a normal ADC's build would be {{item:3095}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3080}} {{item:3006}} the fourth critical strike will only deal 20% more damage, not the 50% more damage of old IE.

If you choose to itemize for more critical strike damage through building 3 Zeal items, you're otherwise giving up sustain/defensive items.

It becomes a careful balance between "Do I want more damage or do I want to stay alive for longer?"

I definitely see your intent, but I'm just not sold on the execution. Any time you're making crits hit squishies harder, especially with all the up-front burst that exists in the game right now, that's trouble.

That's why old IE needed a rework. And this would bring the problem back. I don't understand why Stormrazer needs to interact with crits at all, frankly. I'd rather see another passive that gives it a better niche as an early game item.

Because then it's just shitty Duskblade? That is what stormrazor currently is. It's supposed to give ADCs that little extra oomph in the early to mid game and help them till they reach their late game status... except that it's better on those who don't build crit at all even though it has a passive that "scales" with crit yet it just becomes more and more useless the more crit you build. 

The item needs to either stop being a shitty version of duskblade or actually interact with crit in a way that doesn't make it obsolete

I don't want it to have anything that resembles Duskblade. Like I said, more burst for marksmen = bad, imo.

I suppose the other option is to let it actually help crit scaling... but then it's just a mandatory purchase on every crit adc. Seems inideal. I would rather get rid of the damn thing and figure out some other way for crit marksmen to be successful. 

The interesting items for marksmen are the zeal items. That's where they can make meaningful itemization choices. I want to see them be able to get into those items sooner in the game without feeling like they can't do anything to contest early objectives and participate in early fights. 

I really like the direction they were going when they were talking about making crit items cheaper and stack more efficiently. That made a lot of sense to me. I want to see something like that come back in preseason.

I like the direction you're taking this, and I think stormrazer needs to be changed, but here's food for thought on why this new proposition is a bad idea.
Say every silver player's favorite champion {{champion:157}} get this item, and decides to buy stormrazer, phantom dancer, infinity edge, and statik shiv. Yasuo already has reduced efficiency when you scale his passive with new infinity edge since his new two item spike is 120% crit, but this would cancel out that effect and make him a critical strike stacking monster.

Yasuo as of right now, unless called for, more or less always gets a starter item straight into a phantom dancer. after he does this, with this new item, he would build this second or third, meaning his 60% crit bonus would be giving him 60% more damage every 4 hits, or in other words, a 15% damage boost overall, not accounting for the already existing crit, which would make his auto attacks even stronger. Then you build an infinity edge and and all the sudden you get 220% damage every fourth auto, and 10% of that is converted into true damage as well, plus his already strong late game with having 100% crit with attack damage and attack speed. then after that, what's going to stop him from getting a statik shiv? First auto attack procs shiv passive, which also can crit, does 10% true damage because of infinity edge, and increases the bonus damage he does every fourth auto to 280%, where 10% is true damage. Combine this with press the attack, which does burst damage every third auto and increases any subsequent damage by 12%.

So lets do some math here, at late game when you have 4 items, not counting boots, you not only have extremely cheap items, the average price being around 2800 gold, you get 100% crit chance, 105% bonus attack speed (140% with boots), 10% bonus movement speed, 120 attack damage, 10% of damage converted to true damage,  a 280 damage 5 target burst on first attack, 12% bonus damage to a target after three hits, with another 180 damage burst attached after landing said 3 hits, 12% damage reduction from the enemy you are attacking, 7% movement speed while near enemy champions you are fighting, and with the new passive you're suggesting, every 4th hit, which by the way would scale with press the attack 12% damage boost, would do ONE-HUNDRED AND EIGHTY PERCENT BONUS DAMAGE. not to mention that it would encourage people to auto attack minions 3 times, then just flat out all in the enemy with their free first crit and subsequent crits.

Hell, if I was playing yasuo with this item, I would buy rapid firecannon as well just to fucking do it and one shot literally anyone while having 2.50 attack speed. AND LETS NOT EVEN MENTION HOW BROKEN THIS WOULD BE ON TRYNDAMERE.

- Reduce the AS to 25%.
- Change Storm's Edge's critical damage scaling to (+1% per 1% Critical Chance), meaning you'd need 60% critical chance to max it.

Leading off with a 170% damage critical strike with Stormrazor + Zeal upgrade while having +55-70% AS (depending on Zeal upgrade) is still plenty strong, I think, while not being quite so stupid, then you cap it upon finishing your second Zeal upgrade or Infinity Edge, and proceed to ADC as normal.

I dislike both options and the current one, but I more resonate with the 2nd option. 

Storm isn't meant to be a scaling item but a decent first item power spike that doesn't bring in RNG. It's major problem is the up front burst so moving it's crit back I think is something riot should look into, but it should be more reflective of traditional trading patterns for the tine you would typically get that item. I feel like the 4th auto is a bit much personally ( I would go with 3) and I feel the damage is a bit high in your proposals (I would rather stick to the current 160% and scale to 200). Changing the move speed to scale with crit I ageee with but not for excessive crit. It would make that portion useless for a long time and for everyone that doesn't go for 100+ crit. (There's a few)

I also disagree with making the item ranged only. While I believe the item would be FAR easier to balance that way, it removes diversity from the game which I think we need. Riot also wouldn't do that unless its a last resort, and while the item has its problems, I don't feel we need to go that route just yet. Rather we can instead impose melee to ranged variances similar to other traditional melee items. Such as, a melee procing the ms portion gets 1/3 of the affect oppose to a ranged user. This helps with possible abuse cases. (See below)

Overall I lean more towards idea 2 with some adjustments, but with every change, one has to look at possible abuse cases. {{champion:122}} , {{champion:114}} , and {{champion:202}} come to mind. Sustain damage doesn't just belong to crit users and marksmen, they also belong to juggs and fighters. Movement speed is also not just for kiting but chasing. So any change to an item like this can be possibly exploited by them. It would be a cheaper alternative to {{item:3078}}, giving darius and fiora some scary damage and chase potential. Jhin of course just synergize really well with Storm Razor as a whole so adding a scaling movespeed with crit, both stats he builds and feeds on can be dangerous. Moving the affect to the 3rd auto though might help but that's something riot would have to test and see how they like it.

On one hand, you say it isn't supposed to be a scaling item, yet you want it to start at 160% and then scale to 200%.

On one hand, you want Riot to move back the burst of Stormrazor, yet you want to lower the amount of attacks you have to get off from 4 to 3 in order to get the crit.

> Changing the move speed to scale with crit I ageee with but not for excessive crit. It would make that portion useless for a long time and for everyone that doesn't go for 100+ crit. (There's a few)

ADCs are not supposed to be hyper mobile in the early to mid game.

This is a major problem of a little someone known as Jhin, affectionately referred to as "The Fast".

I wanted the movement speed to purely be something you use to reposition during late game team fights.

> 
> I also disagree with making the item ranged only. While I believe the item would be FAR easier to balance that way, it removes diversity from the game which I think we need. Riot also wouldn't do that unless its a last resort, and while the item has its problems, I don't feel we need to go that route just yet. Rather we can instead impose melee to ranged variances similar to other traditional melee items. Such as, a melee procing the ms portion gets 1/3 of the affect oppose to a ranged user. This helps with possible abuse cases. (See below)

I had no choice but to comply.

> 
> Overall I lean more towards idea 2 with some adjustments, but with every change, one has to look at possible abuse cases. {{champion:122}} , {{champion:114}} , and {{champion:202}} come to mind. Sustain damage doesn't just belong to crit users and marksmen, they also belong to juggs and fighters.

Sustain damage definitely belongs to Juggs and Fighters as well, but crit itself should mostly belong to Marksmen, with the odd Tryndamere here and the Yasuo there.

> Movement speed is also not just for kiting but chasing. So any change to an item like this can be possibly exploited by them. It would be a cheaper alternative to {{item:3078}}, giving darius and fiora some scary damage and chase potential.

Exactly, which is why I added the "excess crit" restriction on the movement speed.

So you can't just buy Stormrazor alone on it's own and get tons of MS from it, you have to build other crit items along with it.

So now Darius and Fiora would have to fill their builds with Zeal items and an Infinity Edge if they want the movement speed.

> Jhin of course just synergize really well with Storm Razor as a whole so adding a scaling movespeed with crit, both stats he builds and feeds on can be dangerous.

This version definitely sounds less dangerous than what Stormrazor's current iteration is.

> Moving the affect to the 3rd auto though might help but that's something riot would have to test and see how they like it.

The best part about Stormrazor is that it changes how a player thinks about auto attacks.

Every other item in the game wants you to attack as often as possible, just mindlessly shoot ad-nauseum, and the more items you get the closer you become to a dps turret whose goal is to stand still as often as possible to maximize dps.

Stormrazor wants you to STOP doing that and wait between auto attacks. Its obviously going for a 'quick-draw' theme where the idea is that if you wait to re-sheathe the sword you can strike out again with more force. 

This style of benefiting patience is the core of Stormrazor, and if it was changed to another item that revolved around spam attacking it would ruin everything that was good and interesting about the item all to make it a superfluous second late-game crit multiplyer.
